intro: Tephroseris papposa subsp. kitaibelii, commonly known as the Kitaibel's tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind, a trait common among members of its family. Its leaves are typically hairy and narrow, adapted to the high-altitude environments where it thrives. This subspecies is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
